header.gameNote: LOU HENSON CLASSIC AT LAS CRUCES NM

article.headline: San Francisco 71, Southeastern Louisiana 56
article.story: LAS CRUCES, N.M. (AP) -- Armondo Surratt hit four 3-pointers and scored 16 points as San Francisco beat Southeastern Louisiana 71-56 Friday night at the Lou Henson Classic. Surratt hit 4-of-6 3-pointers for the Dons (4-4), who never trailed and held a double-digit lead for most of the game. Jay Watkins, whose dunk with 2:16 left in the first half gave the Dons a 36-26 lead, hit 5 of 7 shots and added 12 points. Southeastern Louisiana (4-3) was led by Daryl Cohen with 18 points. Quennell Green added 16 points. The Lions have lost three in a row after starting the season witn a four-game winning streak. The Lions got within 27-25 with 7:43 left in the first half, but San Francisco went on a 13-3 run and led 40-28 at halftime. Surratt took charge in the second half hitting a pair of 3-point shots, the second coming with 15:35 to play. The basket gave the Dons a 48-33 lead. Another 3-pointer by Surratt two minutes later gave the Dons a 51-35 advantage with 13:01 left in the game.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
